result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle L Cardaropoli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[jk] cases 15CM467 and 17CM50 called at 8:15am
Defendant Kyle L Cardaropoli in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; as to case 15CM467 count 1, and 17CM50 count 1, pleas of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses case 15CM467 Count #2.
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel.

As to case 15CM467 count #1 and case 17CM50 count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year in each of the cases, the Court adopts all of the conditions that are agreed upon by the parties [which include:

--no presence at any Kearns Motor Car location
--no presence at Fiesta Garibalidi's in Johnson Creek
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--undergo any psychological, psychiatric assessment as directed by DOC
--no possession of any non-prescribed controlled substances
--take all medications only as prescribed by treating physicians
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge  
--to pay restitution in the amount of $932.00 payable to Jose Rebollar-Fiesta Garibaldi's (17CM50)]
--go to Sheriffs department today to give a DNA sample
--Mr. Cardaropoli is to make repayment for attorneys fees: The Court designates that payment of restitution and then court costs are to have priority. If the Probation term is ending and only attorney fees remain due, a civil judgment is to be entered for that amount.

--The Court approves expungement for both cases, unpon Mr. Cardaropoli's succcessful completion of the Probation term.

Days credit for time already served:  0 days in each matter
recess: 8:34am
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 21, 2017 at 08:10 am.

[MK] cases #15CM467 and #17CM50 called at 3:08pm. 
Defendant Kyle L Cardaropoli in court along with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Initial Appearance is held in Case #17CM50:  
--the Court appoints Attorney Zarwell as defense counsel.  
--Mr. Cardaropoli indicates that his address is:  N5942 Jefferson Road, Johnson Creek. 
--Mr. Cardaropoli verifies that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct.  
--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
--The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint
--Plea of "not guilty" entered.
--The Court requires $500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at Fiesta Garibaldi's in Johnson Creek;  the Court clarifies that Mr. Cardaropoli may walk on the sidewalk in front of the premises, however he is not to enter the business or have other contact with the business 
--if Mr. Cardaropoli has not yet been fingerprinted and photographed in connection with this case, then he is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

As to Case #15CM467 which is set for Final Scheduling/Status Conference and Continued Motion Hearing today:
--the Court notes that former Officer Kerr was given notice of this hearing, in relation to the State's Motion for In Camera Inspection, however he is not present
--Attorney Zarwell indicates that he anticipates a change of plea as to both cases. 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess 3:21pm.


NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on both cases on 3/21/17 at 8:10am.

[MA]Case called at 11:00am 
Defendant Kyle L Cardaropoli in court with attorney David Zarwell.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Susan Love appears for the City of Jefferson /City of Jefferson Police Department.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance


On State's Motion for In Camera Inspection:
--ADA Shock advises that State is not in possession of records in quesiton
--City of Jefferson is the custodian of the records
--Atty. Love indicates that her response is the same as that of Atty. Brantmeier; no objection to in camera inspection and release of necessary records thereafter
--the Court inquires of Counsel the lack of/ inadequate notice to former Officer Kerr.
--the Court concludes that former Officer Kerr may not have received notice in time for todays hearing
--the Court believes that this matter is to be rescheduled to allow former Officer Kerr to receive notice; in the interim if any party can notify the position of former Officer Kerr they are to advise the Court.

recess: 11:30am
